page.title: 04The Ark Museum
page.content: The building which houses the{local {history}collection of brewing tools and folk material was converted by John Smith's Tadcaster Brewery, the first part in 1960-1 and the second part in 1966-7, the whole being opened as a{museum}in September 1967 from when it has become a centre for{ {tourism.}The building was erected in the late fifteenth century and in the sixteenth century, a two story bay was added to the front. It was one of two houses licensed as a meeting house in the town. In the eighteenth century, th building was divided into two. The solar end became a cottage and a shop which it remained until 1959 and the rest was the old Falcon Inn. Recently there has been much debate about the Museum's survival and contrasting{ {attitudes} have been shown.
